services.name: AI-Powered Credit Risk Simulator
services.overview:
The AI-Powered Credit Risk Simulator is a SaaS platform designed to enable credit risk analysts and portfolio managers to proactively assess the vulnerability of their credit portfolios to various economic scenarios and policy changes. It leverages machine learning to simulate credit risk under different conditions, incorporating macroeconomic data, policy changes, and specific portfolio characteristics. This allows financial institutions to perform stress testing, optimize lending criteria, and improve overall risk management. The simulator aims to bridge the gap between static risk assessments and the dynamic realities of the global economy, reducing potential losses by enabling proactive adjustments to risk mitigation strategies.

The platform allows users to define custom scenarios, adjusting parameters such as interest rates, unemployment rates, and housing market trends. It then uses these scenarios to predict the impact on key credit risk metrics, including default rates, loss given default, and overall portfolio value. Users can visualize the results through interactive dashboards and generate detailed reports to support decision-making and regulatory compliance.

Furthermore, the system is designed with a modular architecture, allowing for easy integration with existing risk management systems and data sources. This ensures that the simulator can be seamlessly incorporated into the existing workflows of financial institutions, minimizing disruption and maximizing the value of the tool. The platform also prioritizes data security and compliance with relevant regulations, ensuring the confidentiality and integrity of sensitive financial data.

The AI models underpinning the simulator are continuously trained and updated with the latest macroeconomic data and policy changes, ensuring that the predictions are as accurate and reliable as possible. This continuous learning approach allows the simulator to adapt to changing market conditions and provide users with the most up-to-date insights into their credit risk exposure. Regular model performance reports are available for transparency and validation.

Ultimately, the AI-Powered Credit Risk Simulator empowers financial institutions to move from reactive risk management to a proactive, data-driven approach, improving their resilience to economic shocks and regulatory changes.
problems_addressed: Inability to proactively assess portfolio vulnerability to macroeconomic shocks.
Lack of tools for stress testing credit portfolios under various economic scenarios.
Difficulty in incorporating policy changes and regulatory impacts into risk assessments.
Limited ability to simulate the impact of different lending criteria on portfolio performance.
Reliance on static risk assessments that fail to capture dynamic market conditions.
target_users: Regulatory compliance officers at financial institutions
core_features: Scenario Definition – Allows users to define custom economic scenarios by adjusting macroeconomic parameters and policy settings. Detailed input validation and range constraints are implemented.

Portfolio Import – Enables users to import credit portfolio data from various sources, including CSV files, databases, and existing risk management systems. Supports various data formats and validation checks.

Credit Risk Simulation – Uses machine learning models to simulate credit risk under defined scenarios, predicting default rates, loss given default, and portfolio value. Uses Monte Carlo methods for probabilistic forecasting.

Interactive Dashboards – Provides interactive dashboards for visualizing simulation results, allowing users to explore the impact of different scenarios on key credit risk metrics. Implements drill-down functionality for granular analysis.
Reporting – Generates detailed reports summarizing simulation results, including key assumptions, predictions, and sensitivity analyses. Complies with regulatory reporting requirements.

Model Management – Allows administrators to manage and update the machine learning models used in the simulation, ensuring that they are continuously trained and optimized. Includes version control and performance monitoring.

Integration with Existing Systems – Provides APIs for seamless integration with existing risk management systems and data sources, ensuring that the simulator can be easily incorporated into existing workflows. Supports REST and GraphQL APIs.
Alerting and Notifications - Configurable alerts based on simulation outputs, triggering email or in-app notifications when portfolio risk exceeds predefined thresholds.
user_journeys: A credit risk analyst logs into the platform, imports a mortgage portfolio dataset, defines a recession scenario with specific unemployment and interest rate parameters, runs the simulation, reviews the interactive dashboards showing predicted default rates and portfolio losses, generates a report for regulatory compliance, and adjusts lending criteria based on the simulation results.
ai_capabilities: Machine learning models for predicting default probabilities, loss given default, and exposure at default under different economic scenarios.
Time series forecasting models (e.g., ARIMA, LSTM) for predicting macroeconomic variables.
Scenario analysis using Monte Carlo simulation techniques.
Explainable AI (XAI) techniques to provide insights into the factors driving the simulation results.

Model selection: Use a combination of regression models (linear, logistic), tree-based models (Random Forest, XGBoost), and neural networks (especially LSTMs for time-series data). Consider fine-tuning a BERT-based model for sentiment analysis of news articles and economic reports to incorporate into the macroeconomic indicators.

Embeddings: Utilize pre-trained word embeddings (e.g., GloVe, Word2Vec) for processing textual data related to economic news and policy changes. Vector search will primarily be used for similarity matching in the news sentiment analysis module, potentially using Pinecone or Supabase vectors for efficient querying.

input_data_types: Credit portfolio data (loan characteristics, borrower demographics, credit scores)
Macroeconomic data (GDP growth, unemployment rate, interest rates, inflation)
Historical default rates and loss given default data
data_schema_recommendations: Portfolio Data: Table with loan_id (UUID), borrower_id (UUID), loan_amount (FLOAT), interest_rate (FLOAT), loan_term (INT), credit_score (INT), loan_type (VARCHAR), origination_date (DATE), delinquency_status (VARCHAR).
Macroeconomic Data: Table with date (DATE), gdp_growth (FLOAT), unemployment_rate (FLOAT), interest_rate (FLOAT), inflation_rate (FLOAT).
Policy Changes: Table with policy_id (UUID), date (DATE), description (TEXT), impact_score (FLOAT).
Implement foreign key relationships to ensure data integrity.
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: Ensure compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant data privacy regulations. Implement data encryption and access controls to protect sensitive financial data. Anonymize or pseudonymize data where possible. Document data retention policies.

required_integrations: Data lakes (e.g., AWS S3, Azure Data Lake Storage)
Risk management systems (e.g., Moody's Analytics, FIS)
Email providers (e.g., SendGrid, Mailgun) for notifications
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: OAuth 2.0 for secure API access. JWT for internal service authentication. Consider Clerk/Auth0 for user authentication and authorization, supporting SSO for enterprise clients.

technical_specifications.architecture: The architecture consists of a frontend built with Next.js 14 App Router, a backend powered by Node.js/Next.js server actions, a PostgreSQL database managed by PlanetScale, and an AI pipeline leveraging OpenAI APIs and Pinecone vector database. The system will be deployed on Vercel using a GitHub repository with automatic CI/CD. Communication between frontend and backend will be through REST APIs.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / PostgreSQL with schema notes (JSONB column for flexible portfolio data)
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob (for storing reports and large data files)
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API (for text analysis and scenario generation), embeddings, vector DB (Pinecone for similarity search on economic news)
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST APIs for communication between frontend and backend.

API_design: POST /api/simulate - Simulates credit risk under defined scenarios. Payload: { portfolio_data: object, scenario_parameters: object }. Response: { simulation_results: object }.
GET /api/portfolios - Retrieves a list of portfolios. Response: { portfolios: array of objects }.
GET /api/portfolios/{portfolio_id} - Retrieves a specific portfolio. Response: { portfolio: object }.
POST /api/portfolios - Creates a new portfolio. Payload: { portfolio_data: object }. Response: { portfolio_id: string }.
PUT /api/portfolios/{portfolio_id} - Updates an existing portfolio. Payload: { portfolio_data: object }. Response: { success: boolean }.
DELETE /api/portfolios/{portfolio_id} - Deletes a portfolio. Response: { success: boolean }.
frontend_components: Scenario Definition Form – Allows users to define custom economic scenarios.
Portfolio Upload Component – Enables users to upload credit portfolio data.
Simulation Results Dashboard – Displays simulation results in an interactive dashboard.
Reporting Component – Generates detailed reports summarizing simulation results.

deployment_instructions: Directory structure: /frontend (Next.js app), /backend (Node.js server actions), /database (SQL schema).
Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, PLANETSCALE_DB_URL, VERCEL_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY.
Vercel deployment: Connect GitHub repository to Vercel. Configure environment variables in Vercel project settings. Enable automatic deployments on Git push.
Build output: Next.js static export for frontend. Node.js server actions for backend endpoints.
Runtime settings: Node.js runtime version 18 or later for backend. Ensure Vercel Blob is enabled for large file storage.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers based on the number of portfolios analyzed per month.
Usage-based pricing for API access to the simulation engine.
Premium add-ons for advanced features such as custom model training and dedicated support.

success_metrics: Number of portfolios analyzed per month
Simulation accuracy (measured by comparing predicted default rates to actual default rates)
Customer satisfaction (measured by surveys and feedback)
Reduction in portfolio losses due to proactive risk management
